meanings.definition: Capable of being transmitted from one person or thing to another.
meanings.sent1: The flu virus is highly transmissible among students in a classroom.
meanings.sent2: The common cold is a transmissible illness that spreads easily in the winter.
meanings.sent3: The rumor about the new teacher's pet snake being transmissible turned out to be false.
meanings.sent4: His contagious laughter was as transmissible as a yawn in a quiet room.
meanings.sent5: The idea of happiness is transmissible, spreading joy wherever it goes.

meanings.definition: Able to be passed on or spread to others.
meanings.sent1: The computer virus was transmissible through email attachments.
meanings.sent2: Good manners are transmissible traits that parents pass on to their children.
meanings.sent3: The fashion trend was so transmissible that everyone in the office started wearing similar outfits.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude was as transmissible as a smile in a crowded room.
meanings.sent5: Kindness is a transmissible quality that can brighten someone's day.
